```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(topicmodels)
library(rtweet)
library(dplyr)
library(tidytext)
library(stringr)
library(tidyr)
library(textdata)
```

## Scrapping the data

Here we will use the rtweet package to obtain a number of recent tweets that have the keyword "pandemic". We also filter for comments with more than 10 likes to avoid bot responses. 

```{r scraping}
rt <- search_tweets(
  q="pandemic", n = 10000, type = "recent", include_rts = FALSE
)
rt<-rt%>%select("text", "favorite_count")
rt%>%arrange(desc(favorite_count)%>%head()
rt2<-rt%>%filter(favorite_count>10)
```

## Top 10 words


```{r topwords}
tidy_rt <- rt %>% 
  unnest_tokens(word, text) %>% 
  mutate(word = str_extract(word, "[a-z]+")) %>%
  filter(!(word=="NA"))%>%
  anti_join(stop_words)
tidy_rt %>% 
  count(word, sort = TRUE)%>%head(10)

```


## Top 10 bigrams


```{r topbigrams}
tidy_rt_bigram <- rt %>% 
  unnest_tokens(bigram, text, token = "ngrams", n = 2)%>% 
filter(bigram != "NA")
tidy_rt_bigram %>%
  separate(bigram, c("word1", "word2"), sep = " ") %>% 
  mutate(word1 = str_extract(word1, "[a-z]+")) %>%
  mutate(word2 = str_extract(word2, "[a-z]+")) %>%
  filter(!word1 %in% stop_words$word) %>% 
  filter(!word2 %in% stop_words$word)%>% 
  filter(!(word1=="NA"|word2=="NA"))%>%
  unite(bigram, word1, word2, sep=" ")%>% 
  count(bigram, sort = TRUE)%>%head(10)
```


## Top 10 words


```{r topwords}
nrc_joy <- get_sentiments("nrc") %>% 
  filter(sentiment == "joy")
nrc_sad <- get_sentiments("nrc") %>% 
  filter(sentiment == "sadness")
nrc_anger <- get_sentiments("nrc") %>% 
  filter(sentiment == "anger")
nrc_fear <- get_sentiments("nrc") %>% 
  filter(sentiment == "fear")
nrc_trust <- get_sentiments("nrc") %>% 
  filter(sentiment == "trust")
tidy_rt %>%
  inner_join(nrc_joy) %>% 
  count(word, sort = TRUE)
tidy_rt %>%
  inner_join(nrc_sad) %>% 
  count(word, sort = TRUE)
tidy_rt %>%
  inner_join(nrc_anger) %>% 
  count(word, sort = TRUE)
tidy_rt %>%
  inner_join(nrc_fear) %>% 
  count(word, sort = TRUE)
tidy_rt %>%
  inner_join(nrc_trust) %>% 
  count(word, sort = TRUE)

```
